column4: Having problems with not being able to see 2 of my partitions, this post explains the problem very well, any help would be greatly appretiated.. http://tinyurl.com/5rdpeyk
that is one handsome post, I must say, I don't know the answer, but, could it have something to do with entries? as in only the first 2-3 partions show up by default? long shot
how would i go about changing that?
ps thank you
I don't think that is the prob, what is special about 2 of those hard drives?
Windows 7 is installed on that 1 hard drive but it is split into 2 partitions
the ones that don't show, special how?
how many physical drives are there?
googled it? usb install hidden partions?
doing so now, previously I came across a similar post labeled solved but not solution was given
want to try something for shits and giggles, unplug one of the drives now showing, see if the missing drive/s show up?
i unplugged 3 hard drives and only left the one I wanted to install to and as a result it did not show up
you are installing 11.04, have you tried the cd/dvd, not the live, the one with repair/install
no but I will give it a shot in a second
by the way, i'm in GParted and the hard drive is showing up split into two just like it did in windows
and I've never hidden a drive so I dont know why it would be that...
nothing to lose by trying the dvd/cd
right burning now, thanks for helping
I am talking about the 'alternate' cd, btw
what do you mean?  So i have the default download from ubuntu.com of 11.04 64 bit, burnt to a cd right?
not sure, the default is something like 'desktop-11.04' I assume, and that is not it
the one I am talking about http://releases.ubuntu.com/natty/ubuntu-11.04-alternate-amd64.iso
downloading it
